intro: Mollugo berteroana, commonly known as the Bertero's mossy spurge, is a low-growing annual herb native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by its production of milky sap and often small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
